Agreed. Just closed a financing for one of my startups. Very close on another 2. It will be completely ironic when the cash infused startups that recognize the real situation out there are better positioned than multibillion companies who have #$%$ away all their cash while levering up (both operationally and financially) into this mess.
You are going to be waiting a long time. Amazon could easily have to issue new shares to cover its liquidity needs as reality sets in...
Yep. The new model. Socialize the risk/loss and extract as transaction/management fee tax as much non value added churn/spending as possible....

Volume's been light but it is pretty apparent they are holding this up. just look at how it's been closing on a bump down most days. Today it's been making lower highs and lower lows all day. Cashed out of puts just bought yesterday. I'm still short at an average of $275 in shares held short, not counting profits taken. Let's see how long this stays protected or if it's time to close it sub $280. Let gravity takeover for the scams in this correction.
Whipsaws in the market for those that trade, trade accordingly.

Message.Title: Major milestone breached ... AMZN 2014 P/E dropped under 100!
Message.Msg: $280.98 price on $2.82 forecasted 2014 EPS .. FWD P/E of 99.6 !!!! Value buyers will be pouring in! This, of course is the real issue for AMZN, there is no floor set by either a dividend or value buyers until less than $100. Huge gap between the momo buyers (at $300) and value buyers (at FWD P/E of about 20)

Message.Title: Amazon has been increasigly bad to third party sellers
Message.Msg: Adidas, Gap, ToysR US, .... left Amazon because they saw no use of the greedy bozo Bezos who milks sellers to finance his whims. I got news for you though. People are sick of your promises. You lose money and your stock will be $200 very soon.

Message.Title: Bezos should be in jail
Message.Msg: Years of lying....

Did you see GS made record purchases of GLD while telling all clients to sell? The issue here and elsewhere is not company fraud. This time, it is a completely unethical/broken financial sector driven by unadultered greed filled with moral hazard made possible by asymmetric risk of privatized gains and socialized losses. AMZN will end up exposing many of these abuses because it will have very real cash flow problems soon enough...
